jobs.title: Senior Graphic Designer UAE
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Job

At Lean, we are dedicated to making account-to-account payments and financial data sharing safe and intuitive for millions of users across MENA. As we expand our solutions, we are committed to designing exceptional experiences that place our users at the center of everything we do.

We are seeking a Graphic Designer to join our Design team. In this role, you will help shape our brand experience and visual communication projects, tailoring them for the Saudi market. Your work will directly impact the engagement of the industry with our mission and will help shape and consolidate the future of the Lean brand.

We are seeking a candidate with a sharp visual sense, a keen eye for detail, and a systems-thinking approach. In addition to your strong visual thinking, you excel at crafting designs with words, supporting both our Marketing and Product teams in creating visually compelling and localized content. You'll contribute to everything from public channels and marketing collateral to the copywriting within our products.

Who are we

Lean enables companies to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve their account information. Our products have garnered the trust of leading companies and enabled them to deliver powerful experiences when connected with a user’s bank account, allowing users to perform prudent financial planning, get better rates on loans, transfer money to friends, and more, without compromising on privacy or security.

Some of Lean’s clients include the likes of Ciclys, Tabby, Tamara, Salla, Tawuniya, and many more, making it the region’s most valuable Open Banking platform. The company has now processed billions of dollars, and its products are also connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts. Lean envisions a fully inclusive financial ecosystem that serves everyone, no matter where they bank or live in the MENAP region.

Responsibilities

  • Produce localized and engaging visual assets in Arabic and English. From social media announcements to long-form editorial pieces like reports and white papers which we distribute digitally as well as printed.

  • Bridge the gaps between our Product and Commercial teams to unify all the visual aspects of the Lean Experience. From showcasing our product interfaces in mockups and demos to the entire product marketing resources and technical guides sent to clients using our Design Standards.

  • Support our visual identity and marketing projects by bringing your knowledge of the Saudi culture and identity to influence the look and feel of Lean’s branding.

  • Document future updates to our branding guidelines and advocate for good branding standards across the company and codify our team decisions into solid consistent foundations.

  • Work with Product Marketing, Commercial, and our Client Operations teams to visualize rather complex technical and abstract concepts into elegant, pixel-perfect and scalable reusable graphic resources.

  • Become an evangelist of our Design Principles and Best Practices inside Lean and with our clients and become a local champion in everything related to Design.

Minimum Qualifications

  • You can demonstrate between 4 -6 years of experience at in-house or agency work.

  • You have worked across different types of media, from static to animated, and digital to print.

  • You work proficiently with Figma, InDesign, After Effects, and Illustrator.

  • Your portfolio demonstrates a deep understanding of Design fundamentals: typography, color, spacing, layout compositions, and thoughtful approach to visual styling.

  • You can help your team translate concepts to Arabic from English and vice versa.

  • You have a vast knowledge of the latest trends and techniques in art and graphic design, particularly those being produced by Middle Eastern Design communities.

  • You have a natural ability to codify and document design decisions clearly, maintain a well-organized file structure, and ensure a transparent and accessible design process for seamless team collaboration.

Who you are

  • You see Design as a discipline that can extend beyond just an artwork or an interface. Your craft shows an intuitive and intentional use of Design fundamentals such as typography, scale, balance, space & colors and grid systems.

  • You’re comfortable working within an agile and iterative Design workflow. You feel comfortable translating vague ideas into rough visualizations and then into pixel-perfect artworks.

  • Your work shows elegant and powerful visual communication skills and thoughtful consistency over flair.

  • You’re familiar with design systems and its relationship with brand style guidelines.

  • You’re proficient with design tools and you’re constantly exploring new tools and technologies. You work from the bottom line to the hidden tricks and shortcuts that boost the quality and optimize time-to-outcomes (Our stack is Notion, Figma, InDesign, Pitch and After Effects).

  • You care about elite communication. Both written, visual and spoken makes decisions easier, and keeps everyone informed.

  • Beyond internal communication, you feel comfortable designing with words to help the company address our Saudi audience. You can easily help us localize instructions, visuals, and microcopy.

  • You embrace feedback as an opportunity to deliver your best work and a world-class experience to our customers and you don’t hesitate on raising your bar.

  • You aim to be self-sufficient, prioritizing your own research, and asynchronous communication through documentation and threads before requiring assistance from the team.

  • You’re passionate about technology, financial products and trends across the world. The products we build are used by millions of people in the Middle East.

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

When applying for a job at Lean Technologies, we will need to collect, use and share Personal Data about you with different members of our team during the application process. This may mean transferring your data to members of the team in one of our office locations worldwide outside of the country you are in. Please refer to our Privacy Notice on our website for more information about how we may use and store your Personal Data

jobs.title: Junior IT Support Specialist -KSA
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Job

As a Junior IT Support Specialist at Lean’s Riyadh office, you’ll be the go-to person for keeping our team connected and productive. From setting up MacBooks and managing Google Workspace to troubleshooting network issues, you’ll ensure our people have the tools they need to succeed. You’ll get hands-on experience with modern SaaS and MDM systems, work closely with senior IT engineers, and grow your skills through mentorship.

Who are we

Lean enables companies to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve their account information. Our products have garnered the trust of leading companies and enabled them to deliver powerful experiences when connected with a user’s bank account, allowing users to perform prudent financial planning, get better rates on loans, transfer money to friends, and more, without compromising on privacy or security.

Some of Lean’s clients include the likes of Binance, Etisalat Group, Careem, Sarwa, and many more, making it the region’s most valuable Open Banking platform. The company has now processed hundreds of millions of dollars, and its products are also connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts. Lean envisions a fully inclusive financial ecosystem that serves everyone, no matter where they bank or live in the MENAP region.

Responsibilities

  • Be the first point of contact for IT requests, resolving hardware, software, and account issues quickly and effectively.

  • Support and monitor office IT infrastructure, including Wi-Fi, meeting room tech, and security tools.

  • Set up and maintain MacBooks, monitors, and other equipment for new hires, ensuring smooth onboarding from day one.

  • Assist with MDM, Google Workspace and other core SaaS management.

  • Coordinate with local vendors for repairs, upgrades, and project delivery when needed.

  • Learn and progress within the IT Team, showing an active interest in growing technically.

  • Maintenance of the IT inventory.

  • Support and provide advice on technical questions across all departments, escalating if necessary.

  • Assisting the team to ensure the organization works within data protection guidelines and regulations.

Minimum Qualifications

  • A service-driven approach to IT operations and a desire to progress and learn in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

  • Experience using, troubleshooting and administering MacOS.

  • Experience with cloud directories, such as Google Workspace.

  • Experience with IT ticketing tools (e.g. Jira).

  • Experience with MDM, Jumpcloud (or equivalent) is a plus.

  • Experience with Slack, Notion and Trelica are a plus.

  • Self-starter with a passion for technology, excited to learn more and grow.

  • Strong communication skills both written and verbal English + Arabic.

Desired Qualifications

  • 3+ years in support role.

  • Knowledge of ITIL principles and service management.

  • Degree or certificate in IT related field or subject is a plus.

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

jobs.title: Product Marketing Lead
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Job

We’re looking for a Product Marketing Lead to own how we bring our products to market — and how we tell Lean’s story to the world.

This role sits at the intersection of Product, Sales, and Strategy. You’ll manage a team of PMMs, each mapped to one of our two product verticals (Data and Payments), while personally owning the business-wide messaging - from industry GTM to competitive positioning and investor/regulator narratives.

You’ll thrive in this role if you’re as comfortable writing a pitch deck as you are working with product managers on a new pricing model.

About Lean

Lean enables companies to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve their account information. Our products have garnered the trust of leading companies and enabled them to deliver powerful experiences when connected with a user’s bank account, allowing users to perform prudent financial planning, get better rates on loans, transfer money to friends, and more, without compromising on privacy or security.

Backed by top-tier global investors including General Catalyst, Sequoia and Shorooq, and having recently raised $67.5M in Series B funding, we’re building the rails for Open Finance in MENA. We’re trusted by 250+ clients across the UAE and Saudi Arabia — including the likes of Binance, Etisalat Group, Careem, Sarwa, and many more - making it the region’s most valuable Open Banking platform.

Joining Lean means working on impactful problems, shaping the future of finance in the region, and being part of a fast-growing team that’s setting the standard for open banking in MENA.

Responsibilities

  • Vertical Product Marketing (team management)

    • Oversee PMMs mapped to Data, Payments & Payment Ops products

    • Guide their work on segmentation, messaging, pricing, and GTM planning

    • Ensure high-quality product content, collateral, and enablement materials

  • Strategic Business Marketing

    • Oversees overall value proposition for the company across products and markets

    • Crafts and maintains Lean’s full suite pitch decks for regulators, investors, and large clients

    • Leads industry-specific messaging (industry decks, use case narratives)
      Maintains the competitor matrix per market (UAE vs. KSA)

    • Maintains the industry matrix (mapping of industries to primary/secondary use cases)

    • Supports pricing strategy at the company level, especially for bundles and enterprise offers

  • Go-To-Market & Enablement

    • Lead GTM planning for new product launches across both markets

    • Partner with Sales and Customer Success to drive product adoption and expansion

    • Develop sales tools (battle cards, one-pagers, case studies) that drive conversion and retention

What We’re Looking For

  • 5+ years of experience in B2B Product Marketing, ideally in SaaS, APIs, or fintech

  • Strong grasp of usage-based pricing models, segmentation, and value-based messaging

  • Experience working in (or marketing to) highly regulated or competitive industries

  • Excellent written communication and storytelling skills — you can turn complex into clear

  • Track record of partnering with Product, Sales, and Leadership to drive GTM success

  • Experience managing or mentoring junior PMMs is a big plus

  • Experience marketing API- first products

  • Familiarity with Open Banking, financial data, or embedded finance

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

 - Track record of partnering with Product, Sales, and Leadership to drive GTM success

 - Experience managing or mentoring junior PMMs is a big plus

 - Experience marketing API- first products

 - Familiarity with Open Banking, financial data, or embedded finance

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. jobs.title: Revenue Operations Associate
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Job


We’re hiring a Revenue Operations Associate to join us at a pivotal moment of growth. You’ll play a key role in shaping how our commercial teams operate and succeed. You’ll be the heartbeat of our CRM (HubSpot), building smart automations using AI and no-code tools, keeping data flowing across systems, and helping ensure every part of our GTM stack is optimized for scale. This is not a traditional support role; it’s a hands-on, high-impact, cross-functional opportunity to work at the core of our business.

You’ll work closely with Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and Solutions Engineering to drive efficiency, performance, and visibility across the entire revenue funnel. If you're looking to build, own, and grow in a fast-moving environment, and you get excited by systems, automation, and processes, then this role is for you.

About Lean

Lean enables companies to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve their account information. Our products have garnered the trust of leading companies and enabled them to deliver powerful experiences when connected with a user’s bank account, allowing users to perform prudent financial planning, get better rates on loans, transfer money to friends, and more, without compromising on privacy or security.

Backed by top-tier global investors including General Catalyst, Sequoia and Shorooq, and having recently raised $67.5M in Series B funding, we’re building the rails for Open Finance in MENA. Joining Lean means working on impactful problems, shaping the future of finance in the region, and being part of a fast-growing team that’s setting the standard for open banking in MENA.

Responsibilities

  • Be the day-to-day owner of HubSpot (users, pipelines, properties, workflows)

  • Build automations using AI tools, workflow automation platforms and HubSpot workflows

  • Connect HubSpot with tools across the GTM stack

  • Enrich and maintain high-quality CRM data

  • Create and document internal processes and support enablement across teams

  • Assist in building reports and dashboards that drive better decision-making

Minumum Qualifications

  • 1+ years of experience in RevOps, Sales Ops or CRM/automation-heavy roles (e.g., Sales/Marketing Ops, Growth)

  • Experience with HubSpot (or similar CRMs), and automation tools

  • Comfortable working with data and scoring model logic (e.g., lead scoring, routing rules)

  • Curious, tech-savvy, and excited to own and improve complex systems

  • Strong organizational skills and sharp attention to detail

  • Excellent communication skills and a collaborative, cross-functional mindset

Nice to Have

  • Experience with AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini etc.)

  • Background in a startup or fast-growing B2B SaaS environment

  • Familiarity with SQL, JavaScript or API/webhooks

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

jobs.title: Senior Talent Sourcer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Job

We’re hiring a Senior Talent Sourcer to help scale Lean’s team through precision, proactivity, and data-driven sourcing. You’ll own the top of our recruiting funnel — mapping markets, building long-term talent pools, and engaging high-caliber candidates across key domains like product, engineering, sales, and customer success.

This is a highly strategic role that combines analytics, market insight, and relationship-building. You’ll collaborate directly with hiring managers, the Talent team, and business leaders to ensure Lean attracts and converts exceptional talent across KSA and UAE.

If you love uncovering hidden talent, understanding what drives people, and making hires that strengthen a company’s long-term success, you’ll thrive in this role.

About Lean

Lean enables companies to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve their account information. Our products have garnered the trust of leading companies and enabled them to deliver powerful experiences when connected with a user’s bank account, allowing users to perform prudent financial planning, get better rates on loans, transfer money to friends, and more, without compromising on privacy or security.

Backed by top-tier global investors, including General Catalyst, Sequoia, and Shorooq, and having recently raised $67.5M in Series B funding, we’re building the rails for Open Finance in MENA. We’re trusted by 250+ clients across the UAE and Saudi Arabia — including the likes of Binance, Etisalat Group, Careem, Sarwa, and many more - making it the region’s most valuable Open Banking platform.

Joining Lean means working on impactful problems, shaping the future of finance in the region, and being part of a fast-growing team that’s setting the standard for open banking in MENA.

Responsibilities

  • Top-of-Funnel Ownership: Generate and manage high-quality candidate pipelines for critical roles across the business.

  • Engagement & Conversion: Translate data and research into actionable outreach strategies that attract, engage, and convert passive candidates.

  • Market Mapping & Insights: Build and maintain data-driven maps of target talent markets across fintech, SaaS, and open banking sectors to power hiring decisions.

  • Diversity Hiring: Drive initiatives to improve gender and geographic diversity at the top of the funnel.

  • Data & Reporting: Track sourcing metrics, share insights with hiring managers, and help shape hiring forecasts

  • Stakeholder Partnership: Partner closely with Hiring Managers to ensure alignment, transparency, and performance across every search.

  • Systematic Sourcing: Maintain structured, repeatable sourcing workflows to ensure consistency and scalability across functions.

What we're looking for

  • Proven experience sourcing passive talent from top companies — ideally within fintech or high-growth SaaS environments.

  • Ability to design and execute sourcing strategies that feed recurring pipelines (Sales, Product, Customer Success, Solutions).

  • Strong command of sourcing tools and platforms: LinkedIn Recruiter, Google X-Ray Search, ChatGPT for sourcing automation; sourcing tools like Juicebox are a plus

  • Confident user of Applicant Tracking Systems and CRM tools for tracking, reporting, and campaign management.

  • Strong written communication and candidate messaging skills tailored to different audiences and seniority levels.

  • Knowledge of the UAE & KSA hiring markets and regional nuances.

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager, KSA
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Job

As a Customer Success Manager, your primary responsibility is guiding our customers through their digital journey with Lean. This pivotal role ensures seamless collaboration within Lean's teams to consistently deliver exceptional outcomes for our customers. You'll act as a crucial partner to our customers, drawing on your expertise in delivery, transformations, and facilitating their progression through various stages of adopting Lean solutions. By guiding them through operational, educational, and governance aspects, you'll pave the way for a successful Lean journey.

Who are we

Lean enables companies to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve their account information. Our products have garnered the trust of leading companies and enabled them to deliver powerful experiences when connected with a user’s bank account, allowing users to perform prudent financial planning, get better rates on loans, transfer money to friends, and more, without compromising on privacy or security.

Some of Lean’s clients include the likes of Tabby, Nayifat, Tamam, Circlys, and many more, making it the region’s most valuable Open Banking platform. The company has now processed over a billion dollars, and its products are also connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts. Lean envisions a fully inclusive financial ecosystem that serves everyone, no matter where they bank or live in the MENA region.

Responsibilities

In this role, you'll interface with customers, Lean’s leadership, and various core account teams Sales, Support, Implementation, and Product teams.

Your focus will be on strategizing and supporting customers' adoption plans, translating strategic initiatives into actionable steps aligned with their key milestones.

At Lean, we foster ambitious thinking and encourage ownership of customer challenges. Your role extends beyond delivering top-notch engagements and solutions; it involves proactively addressing customer challenges through innovative ideas and strategies.

Successful candidates will exhibit a strong delivery, data-driven, and strategic mindset. Attention to detail, excellent problem-solving abilities, and exemplary communication skills—both at executive and project team levels are essential.

As a peer leader, your ability to gain stakeholder buy-in, negotiate, and drive teams will be pivotal. Leveraging your enterprise experience and operational excellence, you'll influence decisions, offer insights, and contribute to secure, robust solutions.

Minimum Qualifications

  • ﻿﻿Extensive experience in a customer-facing role, engaging with customer executives, technologists and/or partners to solve business’ problems.

  • Proven track record of building and cultivating relationships with internal and external stakeholders driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts and ensuring follow-through.

  • Experience leading digital transformation programs with a proven record of thought leadership, business case development, realizing customer benefits, and successful program completion.

  • Proven track record of developing customers’ strategies with multi-phase execution and delivery: planning, opportunity qualification and creation, stakeholder and executive communication, needs analysis, value engineering, engagements, opportunity management and negotiation.

  • Demonstrated success identifying business opportunities for clients and increasing adoption and utilization of company products.

  • Data Manipulation: Ability to digest and manipulate data sets by use of pivot tables, lookups and compound formulas.

  • Data Analysis: Analytical problem-solving ability. Uses data analysis, reporting and forecasting to guide business decisions.

  • Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.

  • Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is desired and ambiguity is the norm.

  • Strong organizational and troubleshooting skills with attention to details

Desired Qualifications

  • Fintech/payments industry experience is preferred

  • Bachelor’s / Master’s degree or equivalent

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

 - Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is desired and ambiguity is the norm.

 - Strong organizational and troubleshooting skills with attention to details

Desired Qualifications

 - Fintech/payments industry experience is preferred

 - Bachelor’s / Master’s degree or equivalent

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!


WHY JOIN US?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

jobs.title: Enterprise Sales Manager, KSA
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are seeking a highly experienced sales expert to play an instrumental role in growing Lean’s market share in Saudi, ensuring Lean is the number one Open-Banking player in the Kingdom. In this role, you will be responsible for developing new business opportunities with enterprise companies across various sectors. We’re looking for someone with a proven track record of signing enterprise clients, managing long and complex sales cycles by building relationships with C-suite executives. 

About the Job

Lean is growing rapidly and seeking an extremely motivated individual to play a key role in further growing the business in the MENA region. You will be responsible for the entire sales cycle from prospecting leads via outbound activities, qualifying opportunities, delivering product demos, converting deals to paying clients to handing over your deals to our implementation and customer success teams. You will focus solely on developing new business with enterprise clients across various industries.

Who are we

Lean enables companies to seamlessly connect to their users' bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve their account information. Our products have garnered the trust of leading companies and enabled them to deliver powerful experiences when connected with a user’s bank account, allowing users to perform prudent financial planning, get better rates on loans, transfer money to friends, and more, without compromising on privacy or security.

Some of Lean’s clients include the likes of Tabby, Tas’heel, Tawuniya, Hungerstation, and many more, making it the region’s most valuable Open Banking platform. The company has now processed over a billion dollars, and its products are also connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts. Lean envisions a fully inclusive financial ecosystem that serves everyone, no matter where they bank or live in the MENA region.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute a comprehensive prospecting strategy targeting industry leading companies that could benefit from Lean's open banking solutions

  • Generating new revenue growth in KSA by selling existing and future Lean products to enterprise clients.

  • Own the entire sales cycle from qualification to close and handover to Integration and Customer Success teams.

  • Develop relationships with company leaders from multiple functions (e.g., Technical, Product, and Finance).

  • Respond to RFP/RFQ's and other information requests in an effort to secure a sale.

  • Be the voice of the client in internal product discussions, and influence future product features and developments.

  • Measure and report on success metrics to define sales best practices.

Minimum Qualifications

  • 6+ years experience in a B2B enterprise sales role

  • Experience of navigating long and complex sales cycles 

  • Previous experience selling to enterprise companies in the public sector and/or banks

  • Proven track record of consistently overachieving individual targets and revenue goals.

  • Have outstanding relationship-building, communication, and negotiation skills.

  • Passionate about technology and fintech. 

  • A structured sales approach and experience using a CRM tool.

  • Proven sales methodology and the ability to lead complex negotiations involving bespoke commercial agreements.

  • Strong English language skills is a must

Preferred Qualifications

  • Proven track record of selling software / SaaS/ web services into large Enterprise accounts.

  • Extensive experience in engaging and selling solutions for Government, and enterprise customers 

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, rapidly growing company and handle a wide variety of challenges, deadlines, and a diverse array of contacts.

  • Familiarity with the MENA fintech market and a relevant network of warm contacts in the kingdom.

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

When applying for a job at Lean Technologies, we will need to collect, use and share Personal Data about you with different members of our team during the application process. This may mean transferring your data to members of the team in one of our office locations worldwide outside of the country you are in. Please refer to our Privacy Notice on our website for more information about how we may use and store your Personal Data

jobs.title: Chief of Staff to CPTO
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Job

We’re looking for a strategic operator to be the CPTO’s execution partner, someone who thrives in ambiguity, builds crisp operating rhythms, and turns priorities into shipped outcomes. You’ll sit at the center of Product & Engineering, connecting dots across licensing activations, bank partnerships, planning, budgets, and comms ensuring the org moves as one. This role is designed for impact: you will shape how we plan, communicate, and deliver at scale.

Who are we

Lean enables companies to seamlessly connect to their users' bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve their account information. Our products have garnered the trust of leading companies and enabled them to deliver powerful experiences when connected with a user’s bank account, allowing users to perform prudent financial planning, get better rates on loans, transfer money to friends, and more, without compromising on privacy or security.

Some of Lean’s clients include the likes of Tabby, Tas’heel, Tawuniya, Hungerstation, and many more, making it the region’s most valuable Open Banking platform. The company has now processed over a billion dollars, and its products are also connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts. Lean envisions a fully inclusive financial ecosystem that serves everyone, no matter where they bank or live in the MENA region.

Responsibilities

  • Run the operating cadence: Drive leadership reviews, track escalations, codify decisions/next steps, and ensure owners and timelines are unambiguous, generally increasing accountability and results across the org.

  • Quarterback strategic initiatives: Orchestrate cross-functional efforts led by Product/Tech (e.g., license activation, regulatory readiness, partnership enablement, support on corp dev initiatives) from kickoff to go-live.

  • Plan with precision: Lead quarterly & annual planning; translate strategy into OKRs; better KPI visibility and tracking; maintain a single source of truth for scope, sequencing, and resourcing; support roadmaping, sprint planning, eng resource allocation planning.

  • Coordination with commercial: Be point person for ensuring tech and commercial functions operate cohesively, aligning strategy, targets and comms across both orgs.

  • Own the “front stage”: Prepare company/partner materials, exec readouts, and major presentations; partner on external scheduling and high-stakes meetings.

  • Steward budgets & headcount: Run budget rhythms, investment cases, and hiring plans; monitor burn vs. plan and surface trade-offs early.

  • Raise the comms bar: Draft internal notes, org-wide updates, and partner communications that are clear, concise, and consistent.

Minimum Qualifications

  • 8-10+ years in consulting, strategy/ops, product ops, or technical program leadership (hypergrowth or fintech/regulatory environments are a plus).

  • Technical fluency (engineering or product background preferred); you can engage credibly with architects, PMs, and security.

  • Operator’s toolkit: Planning/OKR systems, program delivery, risk & dependency management, decision logs, and post-mortems.

  • Executive communication: Sharp narrative writing and deck craft; confident with board-level and partner-facing materials.

  • Bias to action: You simplify, sequence, and ship, maintaining high quality without adding process for process’s sake.

  • High EQ: Trusted partner who can challenge, align, and unblock across functions.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with bank partnerships, licensing/regulatory workstreams, or on-prem/regulated deployments.

  • Fintech/payments, open banking, or data platform experience.

  • Arabic/English bilingual.

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

When applying for a job at Lean Technologies, we will need to collect, use and share Personal Data about you with different members of our team during the application process. This may mean transferring your data to members of the team in one of our office locations worldwide outside of the country you are in. Please refer to our Privacy Notice on our website for more information about how we may use and store your Personal Data

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Lean is looking for a Sales Development Representative to join the sales team of one of the most exciting fintechs at the heart of the fintech ecosystem in the Middle East. You’ll be responsible for finding and networking with suitable companies in order to generate leads for the sales team, playing a key role in further growing Lean's business in KSA market. This is a great opportunity for a hungry, out-come driven individual looking to start their career in a fast-paced startup at the heart of the fintech ecosystem in the region.

About the Job

As an SDR, you will be the engine of our sales team, responsible for generating qualified leads and setting appointments with potential customers. You will be the first point of contact for many prospects, and you will play a key role in making a great first impression of our company. Your success will be measured by the number of qualified leads you generate and the meetings you schedule with our sale team

You’ll engage and qualify both inbound and outbound leads in order to create a pipeline that sets the Lean Sales team up for success.  You’ll start prospects on their journey through the sales process, while learning the skills you’ll need to be successful in your own career journey.

This opportunity allows you to get exposure to a variety of industries and personas including senior decision-makers as you’ll lead the initial conversations. You’ll learn about your prospects' business challenges and determine whether there is a use case for Lean product offerings. 

Who are we 

Lean enables companies to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve their account information. Our products have garnered the trust of leading companies and enabled them to deliver powerful experiences when connected with a user’s bank account, allowing users to perform prudent financial planning, get better rates on loans, transfer money to friends, and more, without compromising on privacy or security.

Backed by top-tier global investors including General Catalyst, Sequoia and Shorooq, and having recently raised $67.5M in Series B funding, we’re building the rails for Open Finance in MENA. We’re trusted by 250+ clients across the UAE and Saudi Arabia — including the likes of Binance, Etisalat Group, Careem, Sarwa, and many more - making it the region’s most valuable Open Banking platform.

Joining Lean means working on impactful problems, shaping the future of finance in the region, and being part of a fast-growing team that’s setting the standard for open banking in MENA.

Responsibilities

  • Engage with prospects to kick-off the sales cycle, in order to generate qualified opportunities for the sales team.

  • Use all available channels to identify and contact key decision-makers within the Lean target list of companies.

  • Research customers, identify decision makers, educate prospects and qualify buying interest and sense of urgency.

  • Meet and exceed monthly activity KPIs as well as deliver a high quantity of well-qualified sales opportunities.

  • Develop and maintain reports on prospecting activities, lead quality, and sales pipeline metrics. This includes preparing reports for weekly sales meetings.

  • Develop subject matter expertise on Lean products to consult prospects on the value we bring to our clients.

What we're looking for

  • A keen networker who loves building relationships, and who feels comfortable speaking with C-Level stakeholders

  • English & Arabic language skills

  • Experience in a customer-facing role is required (sales, support, customer service).

  • Experience with CRM tools and passion to set up and improve new workflows to increase efficiency.

  • Understanding of the fintech ecosystem is preferred.

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

This may mean transferring your data to members of the team in one of our office locations worldwide outside of the country you are in. Please refer to our Privacy Notice on our website for more information about how we may use and store your Personal Data

Joining Lean means working on impactful problems, shaping the future of finance in the region, and being part of a fast-growing team that’s setting the standard for open banking in MENA.

Responsibilities

 - Engage with prospects to kick-off the sales cycle, in order to generate qualified opportunities for the sales team.

 - Use all available channels to identify and contact key decision-makers within the Lean target list of companies.

 - Research customers, identify decision makers, educate prospects and qualify buying interest and sense of urgency.

 - Meet and exceed monthly activity KPIs as well as deliver a high quantity of well-qualified sales opportunities.

 - Develop and maintain reports on prospecting activities, lead quality, and sales pipeline metrics. This includes preparing reports for weekly sales meetings.

 - Develop subject matter expertise on Lean products to consult prospects on the value we bring to our clients.

What we're looking for

 - A keen networker who loves building relationships, and who feels comfortable speaking with C-Level stakeholders

 - English & Arabic language skills

 - Experience in a customer-facing role is required (sales, support, customer service).

 - Experience with CRM tools and passion to set up and improve new workflows to increase efficiency.

 - Understanding of the fintech ecosystem is preferred.

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!


WHY JOIN US?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

jobs.title: Software Developer in Test
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We're looking for a proactive individual to join our dynamic team and help us deliver top-tier software solutions. If you have a solid background in modern automation frameworks and thrive in an environment where you can work independently and solve complex problems, we want to hear from you!
In this role, you'll be instrumental in ensuring the quality and reliability of our products throughout the entire software development lifecycle. You'll leverage your expertise to design, build, and maintain robust automation frameworks, collaborating closely with development and product teams to ensure comprehensive test coverage.

Who are we
Lean enables companies to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve their account information. Our products have garnered the trust of leading companies and enabled them to deliver powerful experiences when connected with a user’s bank account, allowing users to perform prudent financial planning, get better rates on loans, transfer money to friends, and more, without compromising on privacy or security.

Some of Lean’s clients include the likes of Ciclys, Tabby, Tamara, Salla, Tawuniya, and many more, making it the region’s most valuable Open Banking platform. The company has now processed hundreds of millions of dollars, and its products are also connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts. Lean envisions a fully inclusive financial ecosystem that serves everyone, no matter where they bank or live in the MENAP region.

Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain robust and scalable automated test frameworks using cutting-edge tools like Playwright, WebdriverIO, and similar technologies for both UI and API testing.

  • Craft detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test plans and test cases based on functional and non-functional requirements.

  • Proactively collaborate with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements, clarify specifications, and ensure end-to-end test coverage.

  • Participate actively in code reviews, providing constructive feedback from a quality assurance perspective.

  • Champion continuous improvement of our QA processes, tools, and methodologies, always seeking ways to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.

  • Work independently to effectively manage and prioritize testing activities, demonstrating strong ownership and accountability for your deliverables.

  • Assist in troubleshooting production issues and accurately replicating customer-reported defects for quick resolution.

  • Stay at the forefront of the industry by continuously researching and adopting new testing tools and strategies.

  • Execute manual and automated tests, thoroughly analyze results, and accurately document and track software defects with clear, reproducible steps.

Required Skills

  • 5+ years of progressive experience in software quality assurance, with a significant emphasis on designing and implementing test automation solutions.

  • Proven hands-on expertise with Playwright and WebdriverIO, along with a strong background in API testing.

  • Proficiency in at least one modern programming language, such as JavaScript/TypeScript or Python.

  • Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, coupled with a meticulous attention to detail.

  • Demonstrated ability to work autonomously, manage multiple tasks efficiently, and prioritize effectively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

  • A solid understanding of software testing methodologies, tools, and best practices.

  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub Actions) and integrating automated tests within them.

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills (Arabic and English), enabling you to clearly articulate technical issues and collaborate seamlessly with both technical and non-technical teams.

Bonus

  • Experience with performance testing tools (e.g., JMeter, LoadRunner, k6) to identify bottlenecks and ensure system scalability.

  • Prior experience working within the payments domain or with complex financial technologies.

  • Hands-on experience with mobile automation frameworks and tools.

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

When applying for a job at Lean Technologies, we will need to collect, use and share Personal Data about you with different members of our team during the application process. This may mean transferring your data to members of the team in one of our office locations worldwide outside of the country you are in. Please refer to our Privacy Notice on our website for more information about how we may use and store your Personal Data

jobs.title: Staff Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the role

Our core product aligns with and empowers developers to build the financial applications they are passionate about. As a Staff Software Engineer, you will take a leading role developing and building the product line that will underpin the future of the financial ecosystem. We are looking for a highly motivated, resilient problem-solver. Someone who seeks out challenges and is ready to implement compelling solutions to complex problems. Your role will consist of knowledge sharing across the entire engineering team, and mentoring and coaching individuals as well.

Requirements

  • 10+ years of experience in backend software engineering, with deep expertise in Java, Spring Boot, and microservices.

  • Strong experience with PostgreSQL, REST APIs, and scalable system design.

  • Proven ability to build and maintain production-grade distributed systems in cloud environments.

  • Drive engineering excellence through reviews, technical mentorship, and best practices.

  • To be self-motivated and comfortable with autonomy, taking ownership end-to-end from design through production monitoring.

  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to multidisciplinary teams and influence positive outcomes.

  • Clear product sense and a true passion for technology and a drive to solve problems at scale, keeping the customer at the forefront of every decision.

  • Track record of mentorship, elevating technical quality across teams, and influencing without authority.

Bonus

  • Strong foundation in Python.

  • Experience working with credit risk and underwriting solutions.

  • Startup/fast-paced environment experience preferred.

  • Hands-on experience across ML/AI infrastructure domains (e.g., feature stores, pipelines, deployment, inference, observability) or data engineering domain.

What excites you?

  • Having the ability to experiment and build new ideas and collaborate with like-minded people.

  • Being a part of a team that is elevating their code to the next level while adhering to best practices.

What's in it for you?

  • Competitive salary and benefits package.

  • The opportunity to work on a product that aligns with and empowers developers to build the financial applications they are passionate about.

  • The chance to work with a team of talented, dedicated professionals who are passionate about the fintech industry.

  • You will join a dedicated and talented team that is deeply passionate about the fintech industry.

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. jobs.title: People Partner
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the Job

Lean is scaling fast, with 130+ employees across our markets, and our People function is evolving to match that growth. We’re hiring a senior People Partner to take ownership of areas such as org design, manager enablement, and performance management, and ensure our leadership and teams are set up to thrive as we grow.

You’ll partner directly with cross-functional department heads, support high-quality decision-making around team structure and talent, and lead the development of frameworks that drive performance, clarity, and culture. Based in Dubai or Riyadh, this role is also critical in providing senior HR presence in our largest offices and most complex teams.

You’ll be joining a small, lean team: this is not a layered HR function. You’ll work closely with senior leaders, and your ability to build trust, influence decisions, and operate with autonomy will be essential to success.

Responsibilities

  • Act as a strategic HR partner to department heads across business and tech

  • Design org structures, team models, and job architecture to support growth

  • Lead manager enablement programs, including toolkits, training, and resources

  • Support performance cycles from end-to-end (timeline, calibration, execution)

  • Drive promotion processes, growth planning, and succession strategies

  • Advise on high-trust people matters including ER cases, terminations, and policy interpretation

  • Own engagement survey execution and follow-up, ensuring action at the manager level

  • Identify people-related risks and propose clear, data-informed solutions

  • Collaborate cross-functionally to build scalable, repeatable People frameworks

Minimum qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience as a People Partner or HR Business Partner in fast-paced environments

  • Proven track record in org design, performance management, and leadership support

  • Strong project ownership and stakeholder management across departments

  • Able to coach and influence senior managers with confidence and credibility

  • Analytical mindset with comfort using data to shape People strategies

  • Excellent communication skills: clear, structured, and tactful

  • Comfortable working in hybrid and distributed teams across markets

Desired qualifications

  • Experience in a tech company or high-growth startup environment

  • Regional exposure to UAE and/or KSA labor laws and employment practices

  • Built frameworks or programs from scratch (e.g. L&D, engagement, growth mapping)

  • Strong judgment in handling sensitive and complex People issues

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
