jobs.title: People Operations Associate
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Lean is scaling fast, with 130+ employees across our markets, and our People function is evolving to match that growth. This role will focus on global employee lifecycle operations, with a strong emphasis on KSA and UAE-based immigration and compliance work. You’ll work closely with Legal, Finance, Office Managers, and external providers to ensure everything runs smoothly. You’ll also take on reporting, payroll inputs, and policy compliance support.

You’ll be joining a lean People team where proactivity, ownership, and speed of execution matter. If you're systems-oriented, practical, and eager to learn, this role will offer strong exposure and mentorship.

Responsibilities

  • Identify opportunities to automate manual People Ops processes and explore and implement tools that improve efficiency, accuracy, or scalability

  • Support visa, immigration, and relocation processes for UAE and KSA

  • Maintain accurate employee data in the HRIS and visa tracking logs

  • Coordinate onboarding logistics (contracts, IDs, system access)

  • Handle employee queries related to benefits, leave, and documentation

  • Own offboarding processes, documentation, and system updates

  • Track visa expirations, license renewals, and regulatory deadlines

  • Collaborate with Legal, Office Managers, and external PROs

  • Support monthly headcount and people reporting (dashboards, trackers)

  • Assist with payroll data preparation and accuracy checks

  • Bring an understanding of employment regulation to support policy reviews

  • Contribute to documenting and improving People processes in Notion

Minimum qualifications

  • 2+ years experience in People Ops or HR administration roles

  • Strong attention to detail and ability to work with sensitive data

  • Organized, proactive, and highly process-oriented

  • Experience handling visa and immigration workflows (UAE essential)

  • Comfortable working with HR systems, spreadsheets, and checklists

  • Interest in growing within a broader People career path

Desired qualifications

  • Experience supporting distributed teams in multiple countries

  • Familiarity with payroll input and review processes

  • Exposure to HR reporting tools or dashboard creation

  • Strong documentation and written communication skills

  • Prior work in a startup or fast-paced environment

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

When applying for a job at Lean Technologies, we will need to collect, use and share Personal Data about you with different members of our team during the application process. This may mean transferring your data to members of the team in one of our office locations worldwide outside of the country you are in. Please refer to our Privacy Notice on our website for more information about how we may use and store your Personal Data

jobs.title: Enterprise Sales Manager, UAE
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Lean is looking for a hands-on Sales expert who is excited to work in a fast-paced, early-stage startup environment and play a key role in further growing our business in the UAE. The right candidate has the ability to build strong relationships, develop a deep understanding of client pain points and priorities, negotiate commercials, and close deals. 

About the Job

Lean is growing rapidly and seeking an extremely motivated individual to play a key role in further growing the business in the MENA region. You will be responsible for the entire sales cycle from prospecting leads via outbound activities, qualifying opportunities, delivering product demos, converting deals to paying clients to handing over your deals to our implementation and customer success teams. You will work with a variety of companies from early-stage startups to enterprise clients across different industries. 

Who are we

Lean enables companies to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve their account information. Our products have garnered the trust of leading companies and enabled them to deliver powerful experiences when connected with a user’s bank account, allowing users to perform prudent financial planning, get better rates on loans, transfer money to friends, and more, without compromising on privacy or security.

Backed by top-tier global investors including General Catalyst, Sequoia and Shorooq, and having recently raised $67.5M in Series B funding, we’re building the rails for Open Finance in MENA. We’re trusted by 250+ clients across the UAE and Saudi Arabia — including the likes of Binance, Etisalat Group, Careem, Sarwa, and many more - making it the region’s most valuable Open Banking platform.

Joining Lean means working on impactful problems, shaping the future of finance in the region, and being part of a fast-growing team that’s setting the standard for open banking in MENA.

Responsibilities

  • Generate new revenue growth in UAE by selling existing and future Lean products.

  • Own the entire sales cycle from qualification to close and handover to Integration and Customer Success teams.

  • Develop relationships with company leaders from multiple functions (e.g., Technical, Product, and Operations).

  • Build and manage a robust pipeline of new and expansion business that will support quarterly and annual goals.

  • Be the voice of the client in internal product discussions, and influence future product features and developments.

  • Measure and report on success metrics to define sales best practices.

What we’re looking for

  • B2B Sales experience within a SaaS company is essential (fintech is preferred) 

  • Proven track record of selling SaaS/fintech products into large Enterprise accounts.

  • Have outstanding relationship-building, communication, and negotiation skills.

  • A structured sales approach and experience using a CRM tool.

  • Proven sales methodology and the ability to lead complex negotiations involving bespoke commercial agreements.

  • Strong English and Arabic language skills are a must

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

jobs.title: Talent Partner
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the job

Lean is building the next generation of financial infrastructure in the Kingdom — and that takes exceptional talent. Today, we’re a team of 130+ people from 30+ nationalities, and our Riyadh office is at the heart of it. In response to our continued growth and new regulatory momentum in Saudi, we’re hiring a Talent Partner to lead end-to-end recruitment across our Commercial and Business functions. This role is open to Saudi nationals only, in line with our commitment to local hiring and talent development in the Kingdom.

About Lean

Lean enables companies to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve their account information. Our products have garnered the trust of leading companies and enabled them to deliver powerful experiences when connected with a user’s bank account, allowing users to perform prudent financial planning, get better rates on loans, transfer money to friends, and more, without compromising on privacy or security.

Backed by top-tier global investors including General Catalyst, Sequoia and Shorooq, and having recently raised $67.5M in Series B funding, we’re building the rails for Open Finance in MENA. We’re trusted by 250+ clients across the UAE and Saudi Arabia — including the likes of Binance, Etisalat Group, Careem, Sarwa, and many more - making it the region’s most valuable Open Banking platform.

Joining Lean means working on impactful problems, shaping the future of finance in the region, and being part of a fast-growing team that’s setting the standard for open banking in MENA.

Responsibilities

  • Recruitment lifecycle: Own end-to-end recruitment campaigns from role kick-off through to candidate signature for entry level to senior positions

  • Candidate Sourcing; Identify the best sourcing channels in KSA to build and maintain diverse talent pools of best-in-class talent for current and future hiring needs.

  • Recruitment Metrics & Reporting: Leverage market insights (talent availability, compensation, target company offerings, diversity challenges etc) to provide data-informed recommendations to our hiring managers and execs. Analyse Recruitment metrics to improve your recruitment processes and performance.

  • Employer Branding; Help promote Lean’s employer brand in Saudi by providing a positive candidate experience. Build Lean’s brand by representing the company at industry events, job fairs, meetups and establishing relationships with Saudi’s top universities.

  • Utilise our Applicant Tracking System (Ashby) to manage recruitment campaigns, candidate communication, build talent pipelines, measure performance and more.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Proven track record of hiring GTM roles (including Sales, Customer Success, and Technical Account Managers). You’ve already developed and nurtured a network of candidates in this space.

  • Startup/scale-up hiring experience is preferred

  • Experience utilising an Applicant Tracking System to manage recruitment campaigns, candidate communication, build talent pipelines and measure performance.

  • Knowledge of using creative sourcing techniques to identify top talent, with a good understanding of local market trends and hiring practices. Able to articulate strategies for diversity.

  • Serious about data - you have experience leveraging market insights to drive decisions and strategies. You’re able to analyse metrics to improve your recruitment processes.

  • Insatiably curious. You look beyond job profiles to truly understand the needs of the business. You’re constantly learning about new recruitment trends, tools, and techniques.

  • Ownership - You take full ownership of your work and you’re accountable for the entire recruitment process and its outcomes.

  • A confident communicator and influencer, comfortable talking to people at all levels. You understand how best to adapt their approach to the audience.

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer (Mid-Level)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Lean Technologies is building the financial data infrastructure for the MENA region. We operate in a highly regulated, security-sensitive environment powering mission-critical financial services with robust SLAs, strong security controls, and scalable, high-performance systems.


Role Overview

As a DevOps Engineer, you’ll help build and run our hybrid-cloud platform across multiple regions and environments. You’ll contribute to Kubernetes operations, CI/CD, infrastructure automation, and observability—working closely with Senior DevOps/SREs to keep the platform secure, fast, and reliable.


What You’ll Do

  • Kubernetes: Deploy, upgrade, and support clusters in GCP and OCI; handle day-2 operations (rollouts, node pools, autoscaling) and troubleshoot common issues.

  • CI/CD: Build and maintain secure CI/CD pipelines for microservices using GitHub Actions/Jenkins; improve build speed, test coverage, and release automation.

  • Infrastructure as Code: Contribute Terraform modules and Ansible playbooks for multi-region environments; follow GitOps practices for consistent deployments.

  • Observability: Operate and tune monitoring/alerting (Prometheus, Grafana, OpenTelemetry, ELK), create actionable dashboards and SLO-aligned alerts.

  • Reliability: Participate in on-call rotations, assist with incident response, and contribute to post-incident reviews and runbooks.

  • Automation: Script routine tasks (provisioning, scaling, configuration, patching) using Bash and Python/Go.

  • Security & Compliance: Implement hardening baselines (e.g., CIS L1), secrets management, and least-privilege policies; follow SOC 2 / ISO 27001 practices.

  • Collaboration: Partner with product and engineering teams to improve platform tooling and developer experience.

Must-Have Skills

  • 3–5 years in DevOps/SRE or platform engineering roles.

  • Solid knowledge of Linux administration and networking fundamentals (TCP/IP, DNS, VPNs, routing, firewall rules).

  • Hands-on with Kubernetes/Helm/containers (day-2 ops and troubleshooting).

  • Terraform for infra automation; familiarity with Ansible or similar CM tools.

  • Scripting with Bash and at least one of Python or Go.

  • Cloud experience with GCP or OCI (comfortable learning the other).

Nice to Have

  • CI/CD: GitHub Actions, Jenkins, ArgoCD (GitOps).

  • Logging & tracing: ELK, OpenTelemetry; metrics with Prometheus.

  • Operational exposure to PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis (backup/restore, HA basics).

  • Security: hardening, IAM design, vulnerability scanning, WAF/NGFW familiarity.

  • Knowledge of Cloudflare or other edge/security platforms.

  • Experience in fintech or other regulated industries.

  • Service mesh exposure (Istio/Linkerd) is a plus.

  • Strong documentation habits (runbooks, SOPs, incident notes).

How You’ll Grow

  • Take ownership of a product area (e.g., observability stack, cluster lifecycle, or CI/CD platform).

  • Lead incident bridges and author RCAs with clear action items.

  • Design reusable Terraform modules and champion GitOps maturity.

  • Contribute to security/compliance evidence and control automation.

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

When applying for a job at Lean Technologies, we will need to collect, use and share Personal Data about you with different members of our team during the application process. Role Overview

As a DevOps Engineer, you’ll help build and run our hybrid-cloud platform across multiple regions and environments. You’ll contribute to Kubernetes operations, CI/CD, infrastructure automation, and observability—working closely with Senior DevOps/SREs to keep the platform secure, fast, and reliable.


What You’ll Do

 - Kubernetes: Deploy, upgrade, and support clusters in GCP and OCI; handle day-2 operations (rollouts, node pools, autoscaling) and troubleshoot common issues.

 - CI/CD: Build and maintain secure CI/CD pipelines for microservices using GitHub Actions/Jenkins; improve build speed, test coverage, and release automation.

 - Infrastructure as Code: Contribute Terraform modules and Ansible playbooks for multi-region environments; follow GitOps practices for consistent deployments.

 - Observability: Operate and tune monitoring/alerting (Prometheus, Grafana, OpenTelemetry, ELK), create actionable dashboards and SLO-aligned alerts.

 - Reliability: Participate in on-call rotations, assist with incident response, and contribute to post-incident reviews and runbooks.

 - Automation: Script routine tasks (provisioning, scaling, configuration, patching) using Bash and Python/Go.

 - Security & Compliance: Implement hardening baselines (e.g., CIS L1), secrets management, and least-privilege policies; follow SOC 2 / ISO 27001 practices.

 - Collaboration: Partner with product and engineering teams to improve platform tooling and developer experience.

Must-Have Skills

 - 3–5 years in DevOps/SRE or platform engineering roles.

 - Solid knowledge of Linux administration and networking fundamentals (TCP/IP, DNS, VPNs, routing, firewall rules).

 - Hands-on with Kubernetes/Helm/containers (day-2 ops and troubleshooting).

 - Terraform for infra automation; familiarity with Ansible or similar CM tools.

 - Scripting with Bash and at least one of Python or Go.

 - Cloud experience with GCP or OCI (comfortable learning the other).

Nice to Have

 - CI/CD: GitHub Actions, Jenkins, ArgoCD (GitOps).

jobs.title: Solutions Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the job

As a Solutions Engineer, you'll play a key role in working with our enterprise clients to understand their specific challenges and design workflows that enhance their operations. You'll partner with clients to help them effectively integrate Lean’s products into their existing processes, ensuring they achieve their goals while maximizing the use of our offerings. Your efforts will enable our customers to shape the future of fintech, making a real impact in the industry.

In this role, you'll be responsible for ensuring smooth integrations between our clients and Lean. You'll lead the technical pre-sales relationship, uncovering technical needs, proposing practical solutions, and demonstrating our products' capabilities. By anticipating potential issues and offering thoughtful solutions, you'll build and maintain trust with our clients, ensuring they have a positive experience with our products.

You’ll be one of the founding members of Lean’s solutions engineering team and so you’ll be involved in shaping how we operate. If that excites you, keep reading.

Who are we

Lean enables companies to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve their account information. Our products have garnered the trust of leading companies and enabled them to deliver powerful experiences when connected with a user’s bank account, allowing users to perform prudent financial planning, get better rates on loans, transfer money to friends, and more, without compromising on privacy or security.

Some of Lean’s clients include the likes of Tabby, Nayifat, Tamam, Circlys, and many more, making it the region’s most valuable Open Banking platform. The company has now processed over a billion dollars, and its products are also connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts. Lean envisions a fully inclusive financial ecosystem that serves everyone, no matter where they bank or live in the MENA region.

What you’ll do

The key KPI for Solutions Engineers at Lean is the consumption revenue of your clients in the first six months after going live with Lean

  • Enable clients to innovate and build the future of fintech with Lean’s solutions.

  • Lead the technical and product sales efforts, recommending best-practice solutions and guiding clients on how to effectively use Lean’s APIs.

  • Establish yourself as a trusted advisor by understanding client technical challenges through discovery processes and designing innovative solutions that address business needs.

  • Ensure an exceptional client experience throughout the project lifecycle, focusing on understanding and addressing client needs.

  • Maximize clients' use of Lean’s offerings to achieve their business goals.

  • Take initiative to identify and resolve issues, both for clients and internally, contributing to organizational growth.

  • Be hands-on, energetic, and passionate, demonstrating creative problem-solving skills and the ability to lead others to success.

  • Act as the voice of our clients to the product team, providing feedback on early products to ensure they meet client needs and expectations.

Requirements

  • High level of curiosity and a willingness to learn, coupled with a strong work ethic.

  • Proficiency in Arabic to effectively communicate with our clients in the region and understand their needs comprehensively.

  • 2-3 years of experience in roles such as solutions engineer, pre-sales engineer, or solutions architect.

  • Strong client-facing skills, capable of presenting and advocating for Lean’s products effectively.

  • Experience working with API companies, with proficiency in calling APIs and debugging high level technical errors.

  • Strong writing skills for effective documentation and communication.

  • Experience as a product manager is a plus. If you’re a product manager or product designer who wants to be client facing, this is a great role for you. You’ll spend a lot of time with clients and use your product sense to design the best possible feature our clients can adopt!

  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to build relationships with internal teams and client stakeholders.

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

When applying for a job at Lean Technologies, we will need to collect, use and share Personal Data about you with different members of our team during the application process. This may mean transferring your data to members of the team in one of our office locations worldwide outside of the country you are in. Please refer to our Privacy Notice on our website for more information about how we may use and store your Personal Data

jobs.descriptionHtml:

Operating in a highly regulated, security-sensitive environment, we serve mission-critical financial services that demand robust SLAs, tight security controls, and scalable, high-performance systems.


As a Senior DevOps & Site Reliability Engineer, you will work at the intersection of DevOps, cloud infrastructure, and SRE. You’ll own the architecture, automation, reliability, and observability of our hybrid cloud infrastructure across multiple regions and environments. You’ll troubleshoot complex problems across the stack—from networking and Linux internals to Kubernetes and cloud-native applications, ensuring the platform remains secure, fast, and reliable.

  • Participate in and lead on-call rotations and incident response, conducting detailed postmortems and RCA reports.

  • Automate infrastructure lifecycle tasks: provisioning, scaling, configuration management, and patching.

  • Champion security, compliance (SOC 2, ISO 27001), and infrastructure reliability best practices.

  • Collaborate with engineering teams to improve internal platforms, tooling, and developer productivity.

  • Must-Have Technical Skills

  • 6+ years of hands-on experience in DevOps and/or Site Reliability Engineering roles.

  • Deep understanding of:

  • Linux systems administration and internals

  • Networking fundamentals (TCP/IP, DNS, VPNs, routing, firewall policies)

  • Kubernetes/Helm/Containers (Setup and day 2 operations/troubleshotting)

  • Terraform for infrastructure automation

  • Strong scripting and automation with bash/shell and at preferably at least one language: Python or Go

  • Cloud expertise with OCI or GCP, ideally both.

  • CI/CD tools: GitHub Actions, ArgoCD, Jenkins

  • Docker and container lifecycle management

  • Logging and tracing (e.g., ELK stack, OpenTelemetry)

  • Operational experience with PostgreSQL , MongoDB, Redis

  • Security hardening and cloud compliance frameworks ( CIS level 1 , etc )

  • Performance tuning and troubleshooting in distributed environments

Desired Qualifications

  • Previous experience in fintech or high-compliance regulated industries

  • Familiarity with multi-cloud and hybrid architectures

  • Exposure to Cloudflare or other edge/network security platforms

  • Strong documentation habits and experience contributing to runbooks

  • Passion for resilient system design and cross-functional infrastructure challenges

  • Experience with service mesh technologies (e.g., Istio, Linkerd)

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. jobs.title: Software Engineer II
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Us

Lean provides developers with a universal API to access their customer's financial accounts from across the Middle East. We realized that infrastructure barriers to entry were suppressing the growth of the fintech industry across our home markets and sought to build a product that would solve that once and for all. Using Lean, developers of all levels of sophistication are now capable of building cutting-edge financial solutions without worrying about the nuances at the infrastructure layer, freeing them up to focus on what matters most to their customers.

About the role

Our core product aligns with and empowers developers to build the financial applications they are passionate about. As a Senior Software Engineer, you will take a leading role developing and building the product line that will underpin the future of the financial ecosystem. We are looking for a highly motivated, resilient problem-solver. Someone who seeks out challenges and is ready to implement compelling solutions to complex problems. Your role will consist of knowledge sharing across the entire engineering team, and mentoring and coaching individuals as well.

Requirements

  • 5+ years of professional experience in Java, Spring Boot, and Microservices, along with proficiency in PostgreSQL and REST APIs.

  • Having an understanding of how to design and develop complex features

  • Experience working in a distributed team

  • Experience working on open source APIs

  • Desire to learn new technologies and implement them

  • Knowledge of Kafka, Redis and No SQL databases

  • To be self-motivated and comfortable with autonomy, with a desire to take complete ownership of the product from inception to deployment

  • Interest in the Fintech industry, especially related to Open Banking

Bonus

  • Experience working in the financial sector

  • Experience working in startup environments

  • Experience developing payment solutions (p2p, B2c, B2B)

  • Experience on CI/CD and Devops systems and processes

What Excites you?

  • Freedom and the opportunity to build and experiment with new things.

  • Being a part of a team that is revamping their codebases and implementing best practices.

  • Joining a team that is elevating their code to the next level while adhering to best practices.

  • Having the ability to experiment with new ideas and collaborate with like-minded people.

What's in it for you?

  • Competitive salary and benefits package

  • The opportunity to work on a product that aligns with and empowers developers to build the financial applications they are passionate about

  • The chance to work with a team of talented, dedicated professionals who are passionate about the fintech industry

  • As one of the first hires in Pune, you will join a dedicated and talented team that is deeply passionate about the fintech industry.

  • You will have the opportunity to play a crucial role in setting the tone and culture for our expanding operations in Pune.

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Our products have received resoundingly positive feedback from developers and customers alike, with Sequoia leading its $33 million Series A round, marking its first in the GCC. Yet, this is just the beginning. We're working tirelessly to expand our coverage across the region while further deepening the value we provide to our stakeholders. To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

When applying for a job at Lean Technologies, we will need to collect, use and share Personal Data about you with different members of our team during the application process. This may mean transferring your data to members of the team in one of our office locations worldwide outside of the country you are in. Please refer to our Privacy Notice on our website for more information about how we may use and store your Personal Data

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

When applying for a job at Lean Technologies, we will need to collect, use and share Personal Data about you with different members of our team during the application process. This may mean transferring your data to members of the team in one of our office locations worldwide outside of the country you are in. Please refer to our Privacy Notice on our website for more information about how we may use and store your Personal Data

jobs.title: Product Manager - Credit & Underwriting
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About the job

Lean is building the foundational underwriting layer for the GCC, enabling lenders to use Open Banking data as a first-class underwriting input, not just a raw data feed.

We are hiring a Product Manager to lead our Credit & Underwriting squad, responsible for transforming bank data into structured, standardised, and explainable credit signals that lenders can plug directly into their underwriting stack. This is the layer that sits between raw transaction data and a lender’s risk engine - the “credit-ready” fabric that makes cashflow underwriting operational, reliable, and repeatable.

Your mandate is to define how Open Banking data becomes fit for purpose for real lending decisions in regulated markets in the Middle East: normalised, interpretable, and underwriting-grade. This role is not about building a scoring model yet - it is about building the infrastructure that makes scoring and policy possible.

About Lean

Lean enables companies to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve their account information. Our products have garnered the trust of leading companies and enabled them to deliver powerful experiences when connected with a user’s bank account, allowing users to perform prudent financial planning, get better rates on loans, transfer money to friends, and more, without compromising on privacy or security.

Backed by top-tier global investors, including General Catalyst, Sequoia, and Shorooq, and having recently raised $67.5M in Series B funding, we’re building the rails for Open Finance in MENA. We’re trusted by 250+ clients across the UAE and Saudi Arabia, including the likes of Binance, Etisalat Group, Careem, and many more, making it the region’s most valuable Open Banking platform.

We are building the rails for Open Finance in MENA, processing billions of dollars in transactions and enabling seamless, secure, and compliant financial connectivity.

Why this role matters

Open Banking has made data accessible in the GCC. What’s still missing is the credit context - the structured interpretation of that data in a way lenders can trust, deploy, and defend to regulators. This squad closes that gap by turning raw streams into underwrite-ready intelligence.

What you'll own

  • The strategy and roadmap for Lean’s underwriting-readiness layer

  • The definition, standardisation, and governance of core financial attributes used in credit decisions

  • Consistency and interoperability of our outputs across lenders, verticals, and jurisdictions

  • Explainability, auditability, and traceability standards expected in SAMA-regulated underwriting

  • Fit-for-use quality of data for credit (not just completeness/coverage)

  • Cross-functional alignment between DS/Engineering and client risk teams

  • Packaging and exposure of credit-relevant information via API in a way that is easy to consume

Example work you'll lead

  • Defining canonical logic for income detection, affordability, liability mapping, and cashflow stability

  • Creating underwriting-grade financial attributes and making them consumable programmatically

  • Establishing governance for versioning, consistency, and auditability

  • Aligning interpretation logic with lender expectations and regulatory criteria

  • Working with embedded lenders/BNPLs to validate attribute correctness and sufficiency

  • Enabling partners to move from data extraction > underwriting integration with minimal friction

What success looks like (6-12 months)

  • Lenders can integrate Lean without building their own transformation layer

  • Financial behaviours (income, obligations, volatility, spending patterns, recurring commitments, etc.) are available as standardised, documented attributes

  • Risk officers recognise Lean as a credit input, not just a data pipe

  • Underwriting teams can justify and defend decisions built on Lean’s data

  • Lean becomes a recognised upstream component of cashflow underwriting in SAMA-aligned frameworks

What we're looking for

  • A Product Manager with experience in data products or lending infrastructure

  • You understand how underwriting decisions are made, even if you are not a quant or a CRO

  • You’ve shipped platform or intelligence products used by external teams

  • Skilled at working across engineering + data + risk stakeholders

  • Comfortable making abstraction and standardisation choices that become industry defaults

  • You think in systems, not single features

  • You bias toward structure and explainability over “black box” output

Bonus Experience

  • Built or worked on lending, BNPL, risk analytics, or alternative credit data products

  • Worked in regulated / compliance-sensitive product environments (banking, fintech, data infra)

  • Exposure to emerging markets underwriting or Open Banking regimes

NB. While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply!!

Why Join us?

Lean is the first regulated open banking and open finance company operating across the UAE and Saudi Arabia.  Since 2019 we've been on a mission to become the pre-eminent A2A payments company in the Middle East - enabling our clients to seamlessly connect to their users’ bank accounts to initiate real-time payments and retrieve account information. Our products have garnered the trust of some of the leading companies in the region, including the likes of Etisalat Group, Careem, Binance, Tabby, Tamara, Tawuniya, and more.

To date, Lean has processed billions of dollars, and our products have connected with hundreds of thousands of accounts across the region. We've recently announced our $67.5 million Series B funding round led by General Catalyst, following earlier investment from Sequoia Capital. This funding marks a major milestone for Lean and the financial ecosystem across the MENA region. At Lean, we’re committed to driving the next generation of financial innovation by making financial data and payments more accessible and transparent for businesses and consumers alike.

To that end, we're always on the lookout for talented, driven, and entrepreneurial candidates to join us in our mission of enabling the next generation of financial innovation. If you're motivated by solving hard problems and leaving a lasting legacy while you're at it, Lean's where you need to be.

Not only do we offer competitive salaries, private healthcare, and flexible office hours, but we also insist that every member of the team hold a meaningful equity stake in the business to ensure long-term alignment. We'd love you to join us for this journey!

Lean is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

When applying for a job at Lean Technologies, we will need to collect, use and share Personal Data about you with different members of our team during the application process. This may mean transferring your data to members of the team in one of our office locations worldwide outside of the country you are in. Please refer to our Privacy Notice on our website for more information about how we may use and store your Personal Data
